Here are my favorites, with a couple other depictions of "lesser" figures.

Saitou Hajime: Kaze Hikaru version!!

Okita Souji: Kaze Hikaru version!!

Yamazaki Susumu: Shinsengumi Keppuroku version.

Yamanami Keisuke: NHK Version! But the fact that he's always smiling is 
kinda creepy...

Kondou: Even though I'm not a big fan of yaoi I'd have to say Soshite Haru 
no Tsuki has the coolest-looking version. Shinsengumi Keppuroku comes a 
close second.

Harada Sanosuke: NHK!! He acts like he's stoned half the time! Heck, knowing 
him, he probably is...

Hijikata Toshizou: NHK Version. But Shinsengumi Keppuroku's Hijikata is cool 
too, but only because it's the same actor who plays Inspector Aoyama in 
"Hatchobori Seven".

Nagakura Shinpachi: NHK version. I don't like the fact that the PMK version 
is a red-haired runt (there's no such thing as a red-haired Japanese), but 
that version totally had the edge as far as humor, though.

Toudou Heisuke: NHK version!! He's so...lost! PMK version was good, but only 
because of the laugh factor.

Matsudaira Katamori: NHK version -rules-.

Yoshimura Kanichirou: Mibugishiden version.

----

That's all, folks!

--M.
